prompt: Generate realistic text messages that represent spam content. These messages should include unsolicited promotions, phishing attempts, scams, or irrelevant advertisements. Vary the tone (urgent, enticing, deceptive), language style (formal, casual, overly friendly), and topics (fake lottery wins, dubious product offers, fraudulent bank alerts). Include diverse formats like short one-liners, longer persuasive texts, or messages with suspicious links or phone numbers. Ensure the content mimics real-world spam while avoiding explicit harmful instructions.
